Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff, clean room, great locations Clean, comfortable, great location and wonderful staff.
Reviews.Author: mgbleuven

Reviews.Content: Nice location, friendly staff My mother and I stayed at the Nuova Italia for 3 nights while in Florence on vacation. The hotel was very conveniently located only a short distance from the major train station. The hotel staff was very pleasant and spoke great English. Our room was by far the largest we stayed in in all of Europe. The bathroom was also large - the only drawback that there isn't a shower per-se, as much as just a faucet on the wall and a drain in the floor with a shower curtain. We take everything in stride, so we just thought it was comical!The breakfast was nice, not huge, but just enough to get you by for a morning running around and hold you over 'til lunch. The only drawback to the hotel in general is that there was no lift and we were on the 4th floor - it took the two of us a good half hour to drag all of our luggage up those steps!! But once we were in our room, it was only a short walk to San Lorenzo and the Mercato Centrale and there were lots of little convenience stores and restaurants in the vicinty.
Reviews.Author: alissac1983

Reviews.Content: Nuova Italia is a one star hotel We found this dreadful hotel in Frommer's Guide. Obviously no one from there has seen this place in years. There are lots of stairs, room was totally devoid of any charm or pleasant decor and there were flies in the window. But we really couldn't open the window anyway after discovering the noise from San Lorenzo market carts which were shuffled down the street at midnight and again at 5am. It would be difficult to really describe how bad the noise was. The entire staff smoked and the breakfast room reeked of smoke. As another poster said, the NI is ugly. We stayed at another hotel in Florence that was lower priced and was, in fact, quite charming. We won't count on Frommer again. We left very early the next am for a flight to London and the only courtesy we got from the staff was a call for a taxi. As someone mentioned, this place may satisfy backpackers but it is really a pit.
Reviews.Author: chatelet

Reviews.Content: small and friendly and very very clean! we came to celebrate my 50th Birthday and enjoyed it . Its so clean and tastefullu decorated and the staff wonderful. This was the third time if visiting. You can keep your big unfriendly hotels. This is central and we love it. roll on next year!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Don't expect much We stayed at the Nuova Italia for three days in March, 2006. The bottom line is that you really can't expect much. While most of the staff is friendly, it is barely worth the money. There is no elevator, so if you have a room on the third floor you had better not have heavy bags; they say is it not their job to help you. Also, the shower floor is the same as the bathroom floor so when you shower the entire bathroom gets wet - and often the bedroom. I won't go back.
Reviews.Author: MilitelloVC

Reviews.Content: Great Find in Florence This modest hotel is well-located in Florence. The rather plain interior is wonderfully embellished with a huge collection of numbered prints (some of really stellar quality) and an eclectic group of museum posters, making the interior both charming and interesting. Beds are very comfortable and its is impeccably clean. Sure the rooms, especially the bathrooms, are small, but you didn't go to Florence to sit in your hotel room, did you? Actually, my daughter (aged 10) and I spent a good bit of time in the room during our recent one-week stay in between outings during some very very hot weather. The room was a quiet and cool oasis, due to more than adequate airconditionion and airport-hotel-quality windows that really blocked the sound of what could have been a somewhat noisy street. Staff is helpful, breakfast is very plain but with outstanding coffee and cappucinos. All the main Florence destinations are within a 5 minute walk. A great place to stay.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good for a two star! After having spent considerable time in two stars hotels through out Europe, people, let me tell you, this is it. This isn't the land of Holiday Inns. What does two stars in Europe mean? Generally: your own bathroom and clean facilities. People being upset because there isn't a lip in the shower? Get out and travel! This ain't america. That isn't a plumbing standard. I bet the bidet really through you for a loop.I found this hotel to be excellent for a two star; EXCELLENT location and the friendliest staff (also, exceedingly helpful with sites/tourism). If you want a Ritz, you're simply going to have to pay for it. And look for four-five stars. Europeans don't just hand them out like we do--they have meanings.That said, for my future travel: I would only stay here when I have children. I fell in love with a three star (Beacci Tornabuoni) for adult travel. But with children, this location would be ideal. (I ascribe to the first class or with children school of travel). And a little bit of a stretch for backpackers!
Reviews.Author: scbelle

Reviews.Content: We loved it I'm amazed by the other reviews of this hotel. We loved it. Our room was spacious and the bathrooms clean and roomy. The hotel staff couldn't have been nicer. It is nicely located within walking distance of the Uffizi, the train station, the Dome, and one of the large open air markets. We spent three weeks traveling through Europe and enjoyed our stay here. We'll definitely be back to Florence and will stay at the Nuova Italia again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Park your 95 Euros for a double room elsewhere The bathroom was so small and the shower area is for smurfs. It's so small that the shower curtain sticks to your body. When you shower, the whole bathroom will get wet because it's a flat floor w/ a drain cordoned off w/ a curtain. Room on the ground floor so it was rather noisy during the day. The room was air-conditioned, so that was a good thing. Conveniently located but not a great neighbourhood.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not worth it... I agree with the other reviewers - Frommers gets this one wrong. Maybe in their early visits this hotel had some charm, but now it's way overpriced for its amenities. It is near the train station in an unremarkable location. The breakfast is very spartan. The staff is not particularly friendly. And the room - very ugly decor, uncomfortable beds, street noise. We would not stay at this hotel again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Should be 1 star, my dorm room was nicer Terrible. Terrible. Terrible. The walls were paper, the rooms tiny and the staff unorganized. The bathrooms are like the restrooms in a trailer home (a drain in the floor and a faucet on the wall). I can't believe Frommer's recommended it. The location is terrible, the facility is awful and I couldn't wait to get out of there.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: I'd stay again, no problem. If you are expecting the Hilton, prepare for diappointment, but in all fairness this place was steps from the Duomo, the room was clean and spacious, and the staff very friendly and helpful, and we had no trouble with any of the facilities provided. The hotel is very close, about a block from the train station. There isn't much of a view if you like to lounge around your room, but if you don't intend to spend your time in your room except to sleep, this is a great place to stay. Internet cafe right around the corner, convienience store nearby, a light breakfast provided, and a comfortable stay. Enjoy Florence.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Crap hotel This hotel is 2 star but it should be 1 or less. To taka a shower one has to constantly adjust cold and hot water pressure. I did not like it one bit. If you get a room on the street side you will not get any sleep. For what this hotel charges I suggest you find something else.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Frommers Is Wrong I have no idea why Frommers likes this hotel. Their description makes it sound like this is an underrated hotel. It's a 2 star hotel and deserves the rating.This place may seem like a refuge if you're backpacking across Europe since it is safe and clean. However, it is not a good hotel. While the common room downstairs is basic but fine, the main stairway is ugly.The room decor is atrocious - very dated 1970s. The orb hanging from the ceiling in our room looked liked like something out of A clockwork Orange.The bathroom was indescribable. The shower drained through a port in the floor. There is not a shower stall. The water pressure was non existent and the temperature drifted continuously. The bidet was broken with no hot water as was the toilet seat. The decor of this bathroom was bright red tile and must have looked good 30 years ago.Finally - the air conditioning scheme is strange. In order to get it to run you have to call the desk downstairs and they turn it on for you. Ours dripped condensate into our room, creating a puddle on the floor.As for Breakfast - this is two star basic as well. Coffee, Juice and Rolls.If you have to choose between staying in this hotel and staying outside the city. Stay outside and stay somewhere decent.
Reviews.Author: hgz

Reviews.Content: Pour le prix, nous n'esp茅rions...   showReview(22049408, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lass=

Reviews.Content: Grosse Zimmer mit allem was es...   showReview(11365651, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lass=
